# NotificationHistoryResponse

**Object**

A response that contains the App Store Server Notifications history for your app.

## Declaration

```swift
object NotificationHistoryResponse
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/Get-Notification-History] endpoint returns this response. Notification history records contain the notifications that the App Store server attempted to send to your server’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerNotifications/App-Store-Server-Notifications-V2] endpoint.

The notification history response contains a maximum of 20 notification history records per response. If the history has more than 20 records, the [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/NotificationHistoryResponse/hasMore] value is `true`. Call [doc://com.apple.appstoreserverapi/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/Get-Notification-History] again with `paginationToken` in the query to receive the next page of responses. When the App Store has no more records to send, the `hasMore` value is `false`.



## Data types

- **paginationToken**: A pagination token that you return to the endpoint on a subsequent call to receive the next set of results.
- **hasMore**: A Boolean value indicating whether the App Store has more transaction data.

## App Store Server Notifications history

- **Get Notification History**: Get a list of notifications that the App Store server attempted to send to your server.
- **NotificationHistoryRequest**: The request body for notification history.
- **notificationHistoryResponseItem**: The App Store server notification history record, including the signed notification payload and the result of the server’s first send attempt.
